Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: The stench of the sewer is strong, it smells of refuse, dying things, and decay.
dark and slimy sewer

This sewer is a very unpleasant place. Smells of garbage, offal, and other things you can't imagine assault your nostrils. The floor, ceiling, and walls are all made of the same drab grey stone, and a putrid green fungus occupies the cracks between. Water creeps down the walls and a filthy rivulet choked with effluvium streams southward in the center of the floor. The tunnel to the north is blocked by a rockslide. A ladder is built into the eastern wall, leading upward to a grate in the ceiling. The sewer tunnel continues to the south.

It's dark. Really dark. You can't see the hand in front of your face. The air feels cold and damp and smells absolutely foul. The sound of dripping water and occasional squeaks and squelches echo in the darkness.
A dank and slimy sewer.
A filthy, dank sewer built of grey stone with a stream of foul water running through the center. The north tunnel is caved in. You can leave through a grate in the ceiling or the south tunnel.
It's dark. It smells bad too.
http://www.skotos.net/IronclawGame/images/maps/night/docktown/streets/sewers/1.jpg
The stench of the sewer is strong, it smells of refuse, dying things, and decay.
the south tunnel
The sewer tunnel continues to the south. Peering farther you see:
The sewer tunnel continues to the south.
You arrive from the tunnel to the south, trudging wetly through the muck.
You trudge wetly through the muck and move south along the tunnel.
arrives from the tunnel to the south, trudging wetly through the muck.
trudges wetly through the muck and moves south along the tunnel.
rusty grate
A square iron grate is inset into the ceiling at the top of the ladder mounted in the eastern wall. It is rusty and scratched, and roughly 3 feet by 3 feet in size.
A rusty square grate in the east side of the ceiling.
You slowly lower the grate closed. It shudders and shrieks painfully before slamming into place in a cloud of rust.
You mount the ladder on the eastern wall, climb to the top, and then crawl into the open grate in the ceiling.
You place your hands against the grate and shove it upward. The neglected hinges shriek in protest and rust flakes off as it opens.
slowly lowers the grate closed. It shudders and shrieks painfully before slamming into place in a cloud of rust.
mounts the ladder on the eastern wall, climbs to the top, and then crawls into the open grate in the ceiling.
shoves upward against the grate. The neglected hinges shriek in protest and rust flakes off as it opens.
swarm of insects

Insects swarm all over the sewer. They react in panic to your light, and move so desperately that you never catch more than a glimpse of them. You are certain there are beetles, roaches, and spiders surrounding you, and possibly other insects you can't see as well.
You can hear insects and barely see them at the edge of your light.
cave-in

The area of the sewers to the north seems to have collapsed, the stones from the ceiling having caved in. The rubble of the rockslide prevents any sort of entry. Stone debris is scattered all along the northern part of the tunnel. Only a small rivulet of water dribbles from between the stones.
The area of the sewers to the north has collapsed, and the cave-in prevents any passage to the north.
the ceiling
The ceiling is made of a drab grey stone. Water occasionally drips from it. Moss and other, fouler, fungi hang from the ceiling like rotten stalactites.
The ceiling is made of a drab grey stone. Water occasionally drips from it.
the northeast corner
The northeast corner of the room.
The northeast corner of a dark room.
The northeast corner of the dim room.
The northeast corner of the room.
The northeast corner of a dark room.
The northeast corner of the dim room.
the northwest corner
The northwest corner of the room.
The northwest corner of a dark room.
The northwest corner of the dim room.
The northwest corner of the room.
The northwest corner of a dark room.
The northwest corner of the dim room.
the southeast corner
The southeast corner of the room.
The southeast corner of a dark room.
The southeast corner of the dim room.
The southeast corner of the room.
The southeast corner of a dark room.
The southeast corner of the dim room.
the southwest corner
The southwest corner of the room.
The southwest corner of a dark room.
The southwest corner of the dim room.
The southwest corner of the room.
The southwest corner of a dark room.
The southwest corner of the dim room.
the floor

The floor is made from drab grey stone covered in a thin layer of colorless muck that sucks at your feet as you walk. Puddles of stagnant water appear now and again, and a filthy rivulet of polluted water moves sluggishly in the middle of the floor. Beetles, roaches, and spiders scurry away from the light as you move.
The floor feels hard, like it's made of stone. It also feels wet and slippery, and your feet stick in what you hope is mud.
The floor is made from drab grey stone covered in a thin layer of colorless muck that sucks at your feet as you walk.
The floor feels hard, like it's made of stone, and also slippery.
some fungus
Mossy fungus hangs from the ceiling like green curtains, and lines the cracks of the walls. Mold grows along the more damp areas of the sewer.
Fungus grows everywhere in the sewer, thriving on the darkness and damp, cool air.
ladder
A series of rusty iron rungs mounted onto the eastern wall, leading to a grate in the ceiling. The rungs are a bit slippery.
A rusty iron ladder mounted onto the eastern wall.
You arrive from the grate in the ceiling and climb down the ladder.
arrives from the grate in the ceiling and climbs down the ladder.
the middle of the sewer
The middle of the sewer has a filthy rivulet of slimy water streaming down the center.
The middle of the sewer.
the eastern wall

The wet, slimy eastern wall is constructed of drab grey stone covered in noxious fungus and filth. At the edges of your light the walls seem alive, teeming with insects. Water trickles down the walls, following cracks and dripping over patches of moss and mold. Small holes, pipes, and grates are spaced along the wall at random intervals, all too small to enter and too dark to see into. The wall is about 12 feet high.
The wet, slimy eastern wall is constructed of drab grey stone covered in noxious fungus and filth.
the northern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high.
The half-timbered northern wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster.

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall of this dim room is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster.

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster.
The northern side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster.
The half-timbered northern wall of this dim room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster.
the southern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered southern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high.
The half-timbered southern wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster.

The close-studded, half-timbered southern wall of this dim room is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster.

The close-studded, half-timbered southern wall is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster.
The southern side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster.
The half-timbered southern wall of this dim room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster.
the western wall

The wet, slimy western wall is constructed of drab grey stone covered in noxious fungus and filth. At the edges of your light the walls seem alive, teeming with insects. Water trickles down the walls, following cracks and dripping over patches of moss and mold. Small holes, pipes, and grates are spaced along the wall at random intervals, all too small to enter and too dark to see into. The wall is about 12 feet high.
The wet, slimy western wall is constructed of drab grey stone covered in noxious fungus and filth.
stream of filthy water

A filthy stream of polluted water oozes sluggishly through the center of the sewer. Bits of garbage, slime, solid waste, and other things not worth mentioning float in its wake. The stench from it is overpowering.
A filthy stream of polluted water oozes sluggishly through the center of the sewer.
You splash through polluted waste water and arrive in a dark sewer.
splashes into the sewer through a stream of nasty water, {$(actor.base:pronoun) |$(actor.base:pronoun)} is announced by a spray of sopping pollution.
The stench of the water in the stream is nauseating. Death rotting in the sun might smell as bad.
